title: icpsrdata: Reproducible Data Retrieval from the ICPSR Archive
text: icpsr_download function (1) simulates visit website specified ICPSR dataset (2) enters required information agrees terms conditions download, (3) downloads dataset’s files, , optionally default, (4) decompresses dataset’s files subdirectory within specified directory (, default, icpsr_data directory current working directory). Datasets specified using file_id argument. ICPSR uses unique number identify datasets; number consistently listed alongside dataset’s name. 2014 Transatlantic Trends Survey, example, file id 36138:  reproducibly download dataset: Multiple datasets may downloaded research area single command passing vector ids file_id. following downloads Transatlantic Trends surveys 2012, 2013, 2014: needed datasets downloaded, , default, unzipped ready loaded R using, e.g., rio::import.
code: icpsr_download(file_id = 36138,                download_dir = tempdir()) # remember to specify a directory for your download icpsr_download(file_id = c(34715, 34973, 36138),                download_dir = tempdir()) # remember to specify a directory for your download

what: Reproducible Data Retrieval from the ICPSR Archive
title: Reproducible Data Retrieval from the ICPSR Archive
text: icpsrdata R package provides reproducible, programmatic access datasets stored Inter-university Consortium Political Social Research archive. install: latest released version: install.packages("icpsrdata") latest development version: Inter-university Consortium Political Social Research, words, “provides leadership training data access, curation, methods analysis social science research community.” ICPSR data archive stores thousands datasets wide range topics. Researchers taking advantage datasets, however, caught bind. terms conditions downloading ICPSR dataset state one agrees “redistribute data materials without written agreement ICPSR.” ensure one’s work can reproduced, assessed, built upon others, one must provide access raw data one employed. icpsrdata package cuts knot providing programmatic, reproducible access ICPSR’s datasets within R. details, check vignette.

title: Download datasets from ICPSR — icpsr_download
text: icpsr_download provides programmatic reproducible means download datasets Inter-university Consortium Political Social Research

title: Download datasets from ICPSR — icpsr_download
code: icpsr_download(   file_id,   email = getOption("icpsr_email"),   password = getOption("icpsr_password"),   reset = FALSE,   download_dir = "icpsr_data",   msg = TRUE,   unzip = TRUE,   delete_zip = unzip )

title: Download datasets from ICPSR — icpsr_download
text: file_id unique identifier (optionally vector identifiers) dataset(s) downloaded (see details). email, password ICPSR email password (see details) reset TRUE, asked re-enter ICPSR email password. download_dir directory (relative working directory) files ICPSR downloaded. msg TRUE, outputs message showing data set downloaded. unzip TRUE, downloaded zip files unzipped. delete_zip TRUE, downloaded zip files deleted.

title: Download datasets from ICPSR — icpsr_download
text: icpsr_download provides programmatic reproducible means download   datasets Inter-university Consortium Political Social Research,  requires user account. Sign account https://www.icpsr.umich.edu  proceeding. avoid requiring others edit scripts insert email    password force interactively, default set fetch   information user's .Rprofile.  running icpsr_download,   , sure add options .Rprofile substituting   info example : options("icpsr_email" = "juanita-herrara@uppermidwest.edu",          "icpsr_password" = "password123!") information found user's .Rprofile, function also   check .Renviron file.  Either file may easily edited via   usethis::edit_r_profile() usethis::edit_r_environ().

title: Download datasets from ICPSR — icpsr_download
code: if (FALSE) {  icpsr_download(file_id = c(3730, 36138),                 download_dir = tempdir()) # remember to specify a directory for your download }
